chunks.en: Let's also talk about betrothal gifts, as a reference for those who are not yet married.
There have been many posts about betrothal gifts recently. As someone who has been through it, I'll give you a reference (a negative example).
First, let me talk about my own situation:
1 My wife is from a mountainous area in a famous betrothal gift province. Her parents are migrant workers, and there are 3 daughters in the family.
2 My family is from Hebei. My parents are state-owned enterprise employees, and I am an only child.
3 My wife and I married through free love. My wife has a PhD. Her tuition fees during university were all student loans, which she slowly paid off after graduation.
4 My family bought a wedding house in Beijing and added my wife's name to it.

5 I firmly refused a sky-high betrothal gift (I didn't have the money for a sky-high betrothal gift after buying the house), and my wife also insisted. In the end, her parents compromised (but still asked for about 100,000 yuan in gift money under other pretexts).
6 Dowry: 0 yuan. Don't even think about the woman's family helping with renovating the house or buying a car. Not a penny.

Don't think this is the end of it. I used to think that I was marrying my wife and that I didn't care about her family. However, I was too naive. There were still a lot of unhappy things waiting for me later:

chunks.en: 1 Don't think that if you buy a house in Beijing, add the woman's name, and your economic level crushes them, and if you are good to their daughter, you will win respect, thinking you are marrying into a good family? As far as the father-in-law and mother-in-law are concerned, if you don't give a betrothal gift, you owe them money, and they will always ignore you and never treat you like family.

2 When the wife's family members (father-in-law, mother-in-law, sister-in-law) come to Beijing, they never pay a penny themselves, and they try to sponge off us as much as possible. Round-trip travel expenses, food, drink, and accommodation are all proactively requested that we pay for them, and they try to make us pay as much as possible. They don't feel sorry for spending our money, and they even have a kind of pleasure, thinking that spending it is earning it. If they can take a plane, they will never take a high-speed train, and they even proactively ask to buy first-class seats. Let me put it this way, I have never seen her family's payment code. They never pay when I am around.
3 When they come to their daughter's house, they always come empty-handed and leave with a large bag of things. My wife's sister takes whatever she likes.

4 You have to give gifts to the in-laws during festivals, but they never give red envelopes to their granddaughter. Over the years, the grandparents have spent a total of no more than a few hundred yuan on the child.

5 When I go back to my wife's hometown, a lot of 'relatives' come. The mother-in-law says that according to their customs, everyone (not just children, but also elderly people in their fifties and sixties) must be given red envelopes, and a banquet must be held to entertain them (the cost is naturally all covered by us).
6 The mother-in-law hinted that the money we usually give them is too little...
Things like this are not outrageous at the moment, but there is really almost nothing happy about them.
My wife and I have a good relationship, so I chose to get married.
When I look back late at night, it is really tiring, helpless, and stupid to get along with such a family.
Always giving, always giving, but there is no response, it's like a bottomless pit.

The purpose of this post is to tell those who are not yet married, and those who are struggling, especially those brothers who have been posting recently, whether you can accept these things, and think carefully. I didn't expect it at the time.
If you don't give, don't entertain, and ignore them, will they tear you apart and eat your bones? You brought this on yourself.
Scary, bro, but your current tolerance is admirableğŸ«¡
What does your wife think about these things? Is she indifferent and unresponsive?

After reading the post, I probably know that the poster and his wife must have a good relationship, and both sides are relatively helpless about this kind of thing. For the poster's family, the money is definitely not a lot, but the problem is that it's a bit of a nuisance. If you spend the money and get a smile or enthusiastic attitude in return, you will feel better in your heart. Nobody's money comes from strong winds, and everyone will be unhappy if they always have to pay out. What to say when you encounter this kind of thing? It is certainly impossible to break up directly, after all, things have not escalated that much. We can only say that we should try to have less contact. The focus is still on our own little life. If we have to flip the table one day, we'll talk about it then (just be on the same side as your wife).
I suggest the OP communicate with his wife, explain his thoughts, and see what her attitude is.

It's not about the betrothal gift or not, it's that you married a country person, and that's how it is. Country people understand that when their daughter gets married, she belongs to someone else's family, so they have to collect some money. City people, working-class families, don't talk about betrothal gifts, the key is the house problem.

I think the problem lies with your wife. This post also reminds everyone that you must discuss with your partner before marriage and settle your own parents for each other and for your own small family, and reject unreasonable demands. This matter can only be settled by one's own parents. If the other party comes, it will easily hurt feelings. Generally speaking, if you hurt your own parents' feelings, they are still relatives after all. Conversely, if you turn your back on them because of this, it's best not to interact with them.

Selfish and stingy person, accept it if you choose it, don't nag. Never thought about respecting his wife, doesn't the wife have the obligation to look after the elderly? There are too many people like this on v station. If you demand equality everywhere in the family, don't get married if you're so tired.

Bro, you think they're like this because you didn't give a betrothal gift, and you're still reflecting on it? They'll be like this even if you give a betrothal gift. My betrothal gift was 0, and my father-in-law is very satisfied with me. Before we got married, my grandmother-in-law said not to ask for a betrothal gift, because people would look down on us, so they didn't ask for it. The two old people are embarrassed to stay overnight when they come to my place. Every time I go to their place, I don't have to do anything, which makes me feel very embarrassed. Every time I go, I bring a lot of things...

In their eyes, your family has a lot of money, but you just don't take it out. Try to help your wife not to be kidnapped by her family of origin, have more contact with the man's family, and when you go to the woman's family, you pretend to be a fool, and you'll be an ignorant son-in-law.

'Especially those brothers who have been posting recently, can you accept these things, think carefully' In fact, this is meaningless. Take the poster as an example. Suppose the poster had a clairvoyant eye and knew everything that would happen in the future, would you give up your other half? The combination of two families is bound to be the combination of two complex vector sets. You can't negate the whole thing because of one point, or one negative aspect. Similarly, claiming that the conflict of values â€‹â€‹in a certain detail led to the disintegration of the two families. This is just an excuse for the two families to part ways.
Thank you, brother, for helping to digest and eliminate Jiangxi women in society. May you live a long and peaceful life.
Won't this affect the relationship between husband and wife in the long run?
It feels terrible just looking at it.
PhD, Beijing, your income is much higher than theirs, I think spending a few thousand a year on your wife's family is not much.
My girlfriend is also from Jiangxi, and I just found out that they have to give red envelopes to relatives and elders, which is shocking.
I feel like these problems would still exist even if the betrothal gift was enough.
If your family is obviously much better off financially, just treat it as 10,000 yuan a year for poverty alleviation. 10,000 yuan less of trouble a year is actually worth it.
The woman should be responsible for receiving and handling the people and affairs on the woman's side. You shouldn't be involved at all.

@dreamingclj Jiangxi girls are okay, but the marriage customs in Jiangxi are too ridiculous, and you and your girlfriend cannot control it. If you decide to marry a Jiangxi girlfriend, you must be prepared for all kinds of betrothal gifts in the future to keep you busy. I am from rural Jiangxi.
